title: A Gathering Hope

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: Yes, sir! The Liberation Army has mounted an assault on the gate! We require reinforcements!

intro.speaker: Djur
intro.line: Hmph. They seek to free their men? My elite guard shall stay here with me. Take the rest to squash these "rebels"!

intro.speaker: Begnion
intro.line: But, sir, if your guard remains here, we'll have barely enough men to--

intro.speaker: Djur
intro.line: Who do you think you're talking to, soldier? With my guard and me at the ready, this camp need fear no attack. Understood? Now go! You have your orders!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Looks like Tauroneo has them distracted. They've left only a small force here to defend the camp itself.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Perfect. That should make it easier for us to eliminate their defenses, seize the camp, and free the prisoners.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Sorry to call you here like this. Forgive me.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: It's quite all right.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Can I pour you some tea? Or is there something else you would prefer?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I'm fine, thank you. What did you want to speak with me about?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: I know you are angry with me. Please, forgive me.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Can you tell me why you stopped showing up at our meetings?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: It was at Izuka's request.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: You are the leader of this army! You cannot simply leave all the decisions to someone else!

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: ...I'm sorry. I'll ask Izuka before the next meeting. I need his permission to attend.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Why? You're the prince. Why should you need any man's permission, much less your own advisor's?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Yes, I am the prince, but...I owe much to Izuka. He taught me everything I needed to know to become a proper member of the royal family. He contacted Tauroneo and the other senators from Daein for help. Without his power and influence, I would never have mustered an army--or met my own mother.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I see. You were alone...

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Pardon?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: And then Izuka reunited you with your mother, gave you a place to stay, and provided you with a reason to live. And you feel you owe him a debt of gratitude for ending your loneliness. That is why you try to do as you are told--as Izuka wishes.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Micaiah, you're--

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I'm sorry! I didn't mean to-- That was inappropriate.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: You're amazing!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Amazing?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: You really can read minds! I'm simply amazed! You saw right through me!

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Sorry, I got too excited. Look at me, I'm sweating.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Prince Pelleas!

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: What is it? Why are you looking at me like that?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: That mark...

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Oh...that.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What is it?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: It's called the Spirit's Protection. The source of all magic in this world is tied to the power of the spirits. When you make a pact with such a spirit, its power manifests on your body like this.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I...see.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: What am I saying? You already know all of this, of course. You have the Spirit's Protection, too.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: I saw you washing your hands the other day. When I walked up to you to say hello, Is aw the mark on your right hand.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: You saw...

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: I thought of confiding in you right away, but my mother called for me. I didn't get a chance to tell you until now.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Do you think this mark is really the Spirit's Protection?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Oh! You didn't enter into the pact yourself?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: No.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: I see. So, it must have been the spirit who wished to make a pact with you.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Pardon?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: It's a very rare phenomenon among newborns. Usually it happens to infants who have an exceptional talent for magic. You truly are amazing, Micaiah.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I don't know about that...

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Let's keep this among ourselves... We don't want people to confuse us with the Branded.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What are the "Branded"?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: I'm pretty sure it refers to beorc who have laguz blood in their veins. I know, it's hard to imagine someone with the blood of a sub-human running through their veins. Anyway, I've been terribly mistreated by people who thought I was one of the Branded.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Micaiah?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Oh...sorry. I think I understand more about you now, and about the marks we share...

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: I'm glad I was able to tell you. I'm surprised you didn't know. Come talk to me again sometime.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Certainly.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Oh, I almost forgot. Here. I wanted to give you this.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What is it?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: It's this splendid sword I recently acquired. It gives its wielder the upper hand in battle. Keep it or give it to whomever you like.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Shouldn't you give it to the soldier you deem most worthy?

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: No, I wouldn't want the soldiers thinking I'm giving anyone special treatment. It would be inappropriate. That's what Izuka says, anyway. So I think you should do it.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I understand. You must have so much on your mind.

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: Indeed. I long for the hold days when I was poor, but had few worries.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Prince Pelleas...

conversation.speaker: Pelleas
conversation.line: But I'll keep fighting. I won't stop until Daein is free once more.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Hear, hear!

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: H-hello...

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Oh, hello there.

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: H-h-hello.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Yes...hello. Now that we have that established, what can I do for you?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Um... Uh... I... I'm...Meg.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Yes, I know. It's nice to meet you, Meg. That's a very nice name.

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: And, uh... I'm from Crimea.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Yep, I'm one step ahead of you! Heard that too. You're far away from home now, aren't you? Quite an independent girl, eh?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Um, and, my village... It's called Ohma.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Oh! You're from Ohma? Now that's something I didn't know.

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Yes.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Then you must know Brom... Hold on a second... You look exactly like him. Are you two related?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: We sure are! I'm his daughter. His...youngest daughter.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Oh, I've heard stories! He loves to tell stories about his kids. He said that you could lift a full-grown cow! It's nice to meet the person I've heard so much about! How is Brom? Doing well?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Yes! Yes, he is! He works ALL the time. I do wish he would slow down...

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Ah, yes. Well, it's good to hear he's staying busy. Brom, huh? Wow, brings back memories... Well, if you're his daughter, I'll do whatever I can do help you. You said you were looking for somebody? Who is this person?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Well... He's my... He's my fiance.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: How could any guy leave a girl like you? What's this lucky guy's name? What's he like?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Well...he's standing right in front of me.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: I'm sorry, I'm sure I misheard you. Can you repeat that? ...Slowly?

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: My daddy told us years ago that he was going to marry one of us to a really nice friend of his, a mercenary named Zihark.

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Whoa, hey now...I don't, uh...

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: But my older sister got married last year, and so I came instead! Oh, it's so nice to finally meet my husband!

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Meg, look, this is kind of crazy...

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Zihark... I'm sure I still have a lot to learn... But after meeting you, I just know we'll live happily ever after!

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Meg, I need you to listen very closely...

conversation.speaker: Meg
conversation.line: Oh, don't worry! I'll work hard every waking moment to become a good wife! Even during a fight! See you later, pookums!

conversation.speaker: Zihark
conversation.line: Meg, wait! Wow, she's downright pushy. She must get that from her old man. ...And did she just call me "pookums"?

battle.speaker: Ex-Daein
battle.line: Y-you really came to save us? Thank you. Oh, thank you. You have no idea how scared I've been. I'm so glad I didn't give up. We knew the Maiden of Miracles would free us.

battle.speaker: Ex-Daein
battle.line: Thank you! I'm saved! I couldn't have held on any longer... I'm going to make a run for it. I refuse to die in this pit of despair. I choose to live and return to my family!

battle.speaker: Ex-Daein
battle.line: This isn't a dream? I can really leave this miserable cage? Oh, thank you. Thank you! You've saved my life!

battle.speaker: Ex-Daein
battle.line: You're the Liberation Army. I've heard about you... I'll never forget my debt to you. If I survive and make it home, I vow to devote the rest of my life to your cause. I'll fight for Daein honor, like you do.

recruit-talk.speaker: Tormod
recruit-talk.line: You! What in blazes did you do?! You scurvy traitor!

recruit-talk.speaker: Sothe
recruit-talk.line: And to think, I expected you to make sense. I have more important things to tend to.

recruit-talk.speaker: Sothe
recruit-talk.line: What I'd really like to hear about is that issue I asked you to look into... How did it go?

recruit-talk.speaker: Tormod
recruit-talk.line: I have news to report. But! There's no time to chat in the thick of a fight. I'll tell you later!

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Ah, hello. It's been a while.

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: Little Sothe... You've grown up.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Why does everybody keep saying that?

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: Hmm?

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: You know, "little"?

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: Oh, sorry. I guess I have to respect your manly pride now.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Yes, please. Or something like that.

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: "Sir Sothe." Will that do?

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Sothe will do. Just Sothe.

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: I'm afraid I could never speak so familiarly with my little one's good friend. So, with your permission... Sir Sothe.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: No! That doesn't... Ohhh, never mind!

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: Muarim, do you remember me?

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: Indeed I do, Jill.

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: I'm glad. So why are you in Daein?

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: You'll have to ask the little one. I merely trail around after him.

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: I see. I will ask him. Thank you for helping us today.

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: It is an honor.

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: Tormod!

battle-talk.speaker: Tormod
battle-talk.line: If it isn't Jill!

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: Thanks for fighting beside us. It's a big help.

battle-talk.speaker: Tormod
battle-talk.line: Ah, it's nothing!

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: How did you happen to...

battle-talk.speaker: Tormod
battle-talk.line: An enemy! Excellent! Leave him to me!

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: There he goes... At least some things never change.

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: Hey there, Tormod. You're looking well.

battle-talk.speaker: Tormod
battle-talk.line: So you're here too, eh, Zihark?

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: Polished your mage skills over the last few years, I see.

battle-talk.speaker: Tormod
battle-talk.line: But of course! I'll toast anyone who dares oppose me!

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: Really? Well then, why don't you take on the rest of the guards while I sit back and take a break?

battle-talk.speaker: Tormod
battle-talk.line: You know what I mean! Get back here and fight like you mean it! Zihark!

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: Muarim!

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: Zihark, has it been three years?

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: First Crimea, now Daein. Never a dull day! Still, it's good to fight with you again.

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: You can say that again.

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: OK. It's good to fight with you again.

battle-talk.speaker: Muarim
battle-talk.line: Beorc humor is so...odd. But you know I feel the same.

boss.speaker: Djur
boss.line: Errrrrgh...! Blundering through like a bull in a china shop... Come closer, so I can shatter your ambition like glass! I will beat into your very bones just who rules this land!

boss.speaker: Djur
boss.line: They were...worthless, trivial... Only...scum of Daein... How? How... could that filth have...

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: We are the Daein Liberation Army! We demand you free the hostages... or face the consequences!

boss.speaker: Djur
boss.line: Of all the ridiculous... All of you pigs from Daein will be our slaves 'til you die! It's your destiny. What need have swine for freedom? Swine are happier being kept...and consumed.

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: If that's how you really feel, then....

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: S-see here! Sothe! Who were those three, and where did they come from? Will they join my Liberation Army?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: They are my personal acquaintances from Begnion. And yeah, they can handle themselves in a fight. But if any more laguz join us, there will be problems. We've managed to hide Volug and his true nature, but...with more laguz, it will surely get out.

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: Any such backlash can be extinguished with proper punishment. But laguz... They're powerful!  Just what we need. By all means, invite them to join!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: They're good friends. I'm sure they'll agree to help if I ask . But... Isn't it the prince--and not you--who should make those decisions?

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: Question me not, young Sothe. My words are the prince's words. You need to understand that. Isn't that right, my prince?

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Ah, ah, yes, that's right. You should do as Izuka wishes.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I...see.

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: I'm glad you see. Now, quickly, quickly...go talk to your friends. And see to it you don't foul up.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: How did you get here so soon? More importantly, how did the investigation go?

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: It went great! In fact, we finished up so quickly that we flew here to back you up in case you needed help.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Um...

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Oh, sorry I haven't introduced myself yet. You're Micaiah, I take it? I'm Tormod! Three years back, Sothe and I were in the Crimean Army...sorta. We fought side by side as mercenaries under Ike.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Of course...General Ike...again.

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: I beg your pardon?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Nothing. Don't mind me. So, anyway, what is this investigation Sothe requested of you?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I began to doubt that the apostle--Begnion's empress--actually knew what was happening in Daein. At only thirteen, the apostle may be young, but she's proud and upstanding. She'd never let these kinds of things happen to Daein. So, I asked Tormod to fill her in on what was really happening here.

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: This is what we learned... The apostle had noticed something shady about Daein. She was investigating on her own. She traced the ones pulling the strings to a certain faction of senators. Now, she's snapping mad, but without proof, she can't publicly move against them.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: The apostle is the highest power in Daein... Even so, she and the senate are rarely on good terms with each other.

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Sothe, she promised she'd help us however she can. She said to do whatever is necessary... And that inspired me to find you sooner than later.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I see. So... I can depend on having you three around, for at least a little while?

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Yeah! Your old pal here is gonna take care of everything. Just try getting rid of me!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I can only try!

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: What do you mean by that?! Ah, you're as blockheaded as ever.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: That Sothe... He looks happy, for some reason.

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Because he's reunited with my little one?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: That must be it... Oh, Sothe, ever since he was small, he's tried to act more grown up than the grown-ups... I've taken care of him so long, and still I've never seen him smile so easily before.

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Hm... Watch what you say. Comments like that... They reveal that your appearance belies your true age.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: What are you--

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Among the laguz, there are those who detest and revile half-breeds such as yourself. They call you "parentless," and deny you any laguz heritage, honor, or dignity. Take due care.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Oh... Oh no...

narration: Laguz warriors led by Tormod join the escaped prisoners, and Daein's army grows ever larger. Its victories at Talrega and other locations have strengthened its position. The army rides across the land, liberating prisoners from Begnion encampments. The Daein ranks swell with the influx of veteran soldiers, and the men begin to dream of the day when they may retake the capital.

Like a fever, conflict grips the nation. The night will be long before this fever breaks. All eyes turn towards Daein's capital as the liberation begins what all believe will be a long and bloody march.
